Definition: You are tasked with selecting one of two alternatives to make the story provided illogical and incomprehensible.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: Sally loved horses. Sentence 2: She always wanted one of her own. Sentence 3: Her parents said she would get one if she did well in school. Sentence 4: Sally studied extra hard and made all As.
Choices: (A) She got the horse she always wanted. (B) Sally decided to get a cow instead of a horse.
Positive Examples.explanation: Sally loved horses and wanted to get one for her. Sally deciding to get a cow instead of a horse make no sense and thus the given output is correct.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: I was looking on craigslist and saw a free piano. Sentence 2: The person needed to get rid of it and I called him. Sentence 3: I got his address and showed up at his house. Sentence 4: When I got there I saw the nice piano.
Choices: (A) I then sold the man my piano. (B) I picked up the piano and then went home.
Positive Examples.explanation: The person was looking for a piano and the man wanted to get rid of the piano. Hence, Option A which is "I then sold the man my piano" makes no sense. Hence, the output is correct.

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence 1: Nancy wanted to take a nap. Sentence 2: Nancy decided that she would nap on her lunch break. Sentence 3: After Nancy clocked out, Nancy went to her car. Sentence 4: Once comfortable, Nancy fell asleep in her car.
Choices: (A) When Nancy woke up, she got out of bed. (B) When Nancy woke up, it was time to go home.
Negative Examples.explanation: Nancy slept in her car and there is no way when she woke up she was in her bed. This makes no sense and thus Output A is the correct option.

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence 1: Gina was carrying a clean bedspread upstairs. Sentence 2: She was carrying it in her arms. Sentence 3: She had a hard time keeping it off the floor. Sentence 4: Her arms were too small to hold the whole bedspread.
Choices: (A) Gina's feet were too big for her shoes. (B) Gina folded the bedspread so she could carry it easier.
Negative Examples.explanation: Gina folded the bedspread so she could carry it easier makes perfect sense. Hence, the given output is incorrect and the correct output is B.
